target.name: Chapter
target.text: Creating a Basic Workflow Process

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Creating a Workflow

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Defining a Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog on the right, click Add a new workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the form that appears on the right, type the Name (workflow name) and Caption (name that appears in Novell Teaming) for this workflow.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Adding States to a Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click PTO Request.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog on the right, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click State to add a state to this workflow.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type the Caption (name used in Novell Teaming), Data Name (database name), and Description for this workflow as follows:

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat these steps to add the Review, Approve, Deny, and Record states.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Defining Manual Transitions for a Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click PTO Request.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Workflow process, expand State - Submit and click Transitions.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog on the right, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Manual Transition.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the To state list box, select Review (Review_PTO_Request) and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat these steps to create the following manual transitions:

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Configuring a Folder to Use This Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: In Novell Teaming, go to the PTO Requests folder in Human Resources.

target.name: Step
target.text: In Novell Teaming, go to the PTO Requests folder in Human Resources.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Manage > Configure menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Allowed Workflows, select the PTO Request option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Apply

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Close.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Testing the New Workflow

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Log in as John Waters (jwaters). See Section 2.2, "Initial Logon," on page 13.

target.name: Step
target.text: Log in as John Waters (jwaters). See Section 2.2, "Initial Logon," on page 13.

target.name: Step
target.text: Go to the PTO Requests folder in Human Resources.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the New > Discussion entry menu item to add a discussion topic.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type the Title and Description information and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the entry title to view the entry.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Workflow > Start workflow: PTO Request menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the confirmation dialog that appears, click OK to start the PTO Request workflow.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Review from the Transition to: drop-down list and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Deny from the Transition to: drop-down list and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Workflow > Stop workflow: PTO Request menu item to stop the workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Workflow > Start workflow: PTO Request menu item to start the workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Transition the entry through all the states (except Deny) until you reach Record (no transitions exist from Record).

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Setting Access Controls

target.name: Sect2
target.text: What is Access Control?

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Planning Access Control

target.name: Table
target.text: Access Control Planning

target.name: row
target.text: State

target.name: row
target.text: Submit

target.name: row
target.text: Review

target.name: row
target.text: Approve

target.name: row
target.text: Deny

target.name: row
target.text: Record

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Setting Access Rights

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click PTO Request.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add the Access controls to the workflow states:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click State - Submit.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click State - Submit.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog on the right, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat Step 6a through Step 6c for each state to add the Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Set the Read access rights:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Under State - Submit, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under State - Submit, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Read access.

target.name: Step
target.text: Deselect the Folder default access option, select the Entry creator option, add the Managers group, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat Step 7a through Step 7d for each state to add the Read access rights (make sure to give the Human Resources group Read access rights in the Approve and Record states).

target.name: Step
target.text: Set the Transition out of this state access controls:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Under State - Submit, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under State - Submit, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Transition out of this state.

target.name: Step
target.text: Deselect the Folder default access option, add the Managers group, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat Step 8a through Step 8d for the Review and Approve states with the following rights:

target.name: Step
target.text: Set the Transition into this state access controls:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Under State - Review, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under State - Review, click Access controls.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Transition into this state.

target.name: Step
target.text: Deselect the Folder default access option, add the Managers group, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat Step 9a through Step 9d for the Approve, Deny, and Record states with the following rights:

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Defining an On Entry Process:

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click PTO Request.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click State - Submit.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog on the right, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click On entry.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Adding a Notification to the On Entry Process

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Workflow designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow processes.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click PTO Request.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Workflow process.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand State - Submit.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click On entry.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Notifications.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add the Managers group to the form that appears.

target.name: Step
target.text: Type a subject line for this notification and click the Append the entry body option to use the entry in the body of the notification e-mail.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK to create the notification.

target.name: Step
target.text: Repeat tthis procedure to create a notification of request approval and a notification of request denied with the following settings:

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Testing the Notifications

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Summary

target.name: Sect1
target.text: Using the Workflow in a Folder

target.name: Procedure
target.text: In Novell Teaming, go to the PTO Requests folder in Human Resources.

target.name: Step
target.text: In Novell Teaming, go to the PTO Requests folder in Human Resources.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Manage > Configure menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Allowed Views, select the Discussion folder viewed as a table and Discussion folder viewed as a list options, deselect any others, then click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Default view, select the Discussion folder viewed as a list option, then click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Default entry types, select the Time Off entry type, deselect any others, then click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Allowed Workflows, select the PTO Request option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Apply

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Workflow associations, select PTO Request from the Time Off drop-down list, then click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Close.
